intro: Matelea fiebrigii, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, emitting a sweet fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and glossy, while its stems are woody and often branched. Matelea fiebrigii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
